item.title: By: Cabin Campbell
item.dc:creator: Cabin Campbell
item.description: I was flattered that you used my graphic, Dr. No, to help illustrate your article. If your readers liked that, there are more at http://thestrangestadventures.blogspot.com/. You have a great blog, keep up the good work!

item.title: By: Jeffrey Boyle
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Boyle
item.description: Ron Paul was the only candidate who mentioned bring back the thousands of hired mercenaries we've left in Iraq. The savings we would get just from disengaging ourselves from conflicts around the world would be enough to make a significant dent in the deficit. Realistically this is one of the few things a president would be able to do without resistance from a possibly democratic house or congress after the 2012 elections.
item.content:encoded: Ron Paul was the only candidate who mentioned bring back the thousands of hired mercenaries we’ve left in Iraq. The savings we would get just from disengaging ourselves from conflicts around the world would be enough to make a significant dent in the deficit. Realistically this is one of the few things a president would be able to do without resistance from a possibly democratic house or congress after the 2012 elections.

item.title: By: Stan
item.dc:creator: Stan
item.description: To learn more about Dr.Paul I would recommend reading a few of his books.Liberty Defined would be a great start.Just a note,he has always voted with the constitution as his guide line.
item.content:encoded: To learn more about Dr.Paul I would recommend reading a few of his books.Liberty Defined would be a great start.Just a note,he has always voted with the constitution as his guide line.

item.title: By: James H Edmonds
item.dc:creator: James H Edmonds
item.description: I fully agree with, and support Dr Ron Paul. I wish he would bring to the discussion the scenario going on Europe...Dr Paul should point out our need to avoid the disasters caused by the overspending in Rome and Athens...Please!
item.content:encoded: I fully agree with, and support Dr Ron Paul. I wish he would bring to the discussion the scenario going on Europe…Dr Paul should point out our need to avoid the disasters caused by the overspending in Rome and Athens…Please!
